ChessGameKenai
Class ChessBoardView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      ChessGameKenai.ChessBoardView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public final class ChessBoardView
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.util.Observer

The ChessBoardView Class is main view of the chess game it consists of the chess board, squares and pieces.This view is an observer so each time the change occurs in the model(Chess_Data) it is notified immediately and changes its view accordingly This class is pure GUI of our chess game it interacts with the user by showing him the changes he made like piece move game won and etc.. This view has a lot of options user can change his name or he can change his icon, there is also possible to save the game as well as the player

See Also:
Interface, JFrame, Serialized Form

Method Summary
 void chooseNameLocal()
          The method chooseNameLocal is used if the user wants to change its name and the game is local game this method is used when the user is playing the game locally
 void chooseNameOnLine()
          The method chooseNameOnLine is used when the user is playing online so the name he chose for himself will be shown on the other client view it is done by sending the name through a socket and setting it in the players ArrayList in the data each time the view is notified it extracts the name from the data class and displays it
 void flipClientBoard()
          The method flipClientBoard automatically flips the board for the client side if the game is played online for easier view on the client side however if the client decides to switch back the view he would simply go in the options menu and change the flip back
static ConnectionBridge getConnectionInstance()
          The method getConnectionInstance is a static method here we use a Singleton pattern to get the instance of the ConnectionBrodge class
 javax.swing.JTextArea getMoves()
          The method getMoves simply returns the text area of moves to the caller
 javax.swing.JPanel getPanel()
          getPanel simply returns a JPanel to the caller
 void loadCapturedPieces()
          The method loadCapturedPieces is used when the saved game is loaded back and the capturedPieces ArrayList is not empty it takes the captured pieces and adds them to the appropriate captured pieces panel white or black
 void playOnLine()
          The method playOnLine simply starts the game on line it restarts the game clears the captured pieces sets the isServer and isGameOnLine to true and calls another method of this class which is restartLocalGame to complete the job
 void promptUserOnExit()
          The method promptUserOnExit simply asks the user if he wants to save the game or not if yes the JFileChoose pops up to save the game if no or yes was pressed the program will exit if the user wants to cancel the exit there is a third option cancel which disposes of the dialog but the game is still there
 void reEnableMenuItems(boolean enable)
          The method reEnableMenuItems simply set enable false or true to the options menu item connect as server and connect as client
 void resetAllSquares()
          The method resetAllSquares simply resets all squares to their original color checks each square for their background color and if the background is blue then it switches the background back to original color
 void restartClientGame()
          The method restartClientGame online game appropriately removes captured pieces creates new visual and non visual pieces adds and removes listeners depending on who's server or a client
 void restartLocalGame()
          The method restartLocalGame restarts local game that means that if the user plays locally we use this method if the user plays on the same computer locally
 void restartOnlineGame()
          The method restartOnlineGame is used if the user plays online against an opponent and wants to restart the game The information is sent to the client on the other side and restarts its game as well
 void setConnectionBridge(ConnectionBridge bridge)
          The method setConnectionBridge simply sets the ConnectionBridge to what the programmer desires
 void startGameThroughChat(boolean isServer, java.net.InetAddress ipAdress, Client client)
          The method startGameThroughPrivateChat simply starts the chess game through private chat the parameters will decide whether to create a server or a client
 void startTimer()
          This method simply starts the timer when it is called by starting the first player timer then the first player timer will start the second player timer an so on.....
 void stopTimer()
          The method stopTimer stops both timers whenever we need we could call this method and both timers would In our case we would use this method if the game was won by either party

          The method update is inherited from Observer Interface needs to be implemented in our class

chooseNameLocal

public void chooseNameLocal()
The method chooseNameLocal is used if the user wants to change its name and the game is local game this method is used when the user is playing the game locally

chooseNameOnLine

public void chooseNameOnLine()
The method chooseNameOnLine is used when the user is playing online so the name he chose for himself will be shown on the other client view it is done by sending the name through a socket and setting it in the players ArrayList in the data each time the view is notified it extracts the name from the data class and displays it

startTimer

public void startTimer()
This method simply starts the timer when it is called by starting the first player timer then the first player timer will start the second player timer an so on.....

loadCapturedPieces

public void loadCapturedPieces()
The method loadCapturedPieces is used when the saved game is loaded back and the capturedPieces ArrayList is not empty it takes the captured pieces and adds them to the appropriate captured pieces panel white or black

restartLocalGame

public void restartLocalGame()
The method restartLocalGame restarts local game that means that if the user plays locally we use this method if the user plays on the same computer locally

restartOnlineGame

public void restartOnlineGame()
The method restartOnlineGame is used if the user plays online against an opponent and wants to restart the game The information is sent to the client on the other side and restarts its game as well

restartClientGame

public void restartClientGame()
The method restartClientGame online game appropriately removes captured pieces creates new visual and non visual pieces adds and removes listeners depending on who's server or a client

public static ConnectionBridge getConnectionInstance()
The method getConnectionInstance is a static method here we use a Singleton pattern to get the instance of the ConnectionBrodge class

reEnableMenuItems

public void reEnableMenuItems(boolean enable)
The method reEnableMenuItems simply set enable false or true to the options menu item connect as server and connect as client

Parameters:
enable - as a boolean

stopTimer

public void stopTimer()
The method stopTimer stops both timers whenever we need we could call this method and both timers would In our case we would use this method if the game was won by either party

promptUserOnExit

public void promptUserOnExit()
The method promptUserOnExit simply asks the user if he wants to save the game or not if yes the JFileChoose pops up to save the game if no or yes was pressed the program will exit if the user wants to cancel the exit there is a third option cancel which disposes of the dialog but the game is still there

resetAllSquares

public void resetAllSquares()
The method resetAllSquares simply resets all squares to their original color checks each square for their background color and if the background is blue then it switches the background back to original color

playOnLine

public void playOnLine()
The method playOnLine simply starts the game on line it restarts the game clears the captured pieces sets the isServer and isGameOnLine to true and calls another method of this class which is restartLocalGame to complete the job

flipClientBoard

public void flipClientBoard()
The method flipClientBoard automatically flips the board for the client side if the game is played online for easier view on the client side however if the client decides to switch back the view he would simply go in the options menu and change the flip back

startGameThroughChat

public void startGameThroughChat(boolean isServer,
                                 java.net.InetAddress ipAdress,
                                 Client client)
The method startGameThroughPrivateChat simply starts the chess game through private chat the parameters will decide whether to create a server or a client

Parameters:
isServer - as a boolean
ipAdress - as an InetAddress object
client - as a Client object
